text: Jalal Bholana is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Jalal Bholana. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch, who is an elected representative. == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Jalal Bholana has total number of 219 houses and population of 1,028 of which include 548 males and 480 females. Literacy rate of Jalal Bholana is 91.91%, higher than state average of 75.84%. The population of children under the age of 6 years is 89 which is 8.66% of total population of Jalal Bholana, and child sex ratio is approximately 1225, higher than state average of 846. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" !
